text: The festival is intended for everyone who is just a little bit interested in the world of specialty coffee. It doesn't matter if you are a professional in the industry, a coffee enthusiast or if you tasted your first v60 yesterday and are just getting acquainted. And if the caffeine gets to be too much for you - the festival offers an alternative in the form of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks and savoury and sweet treats.
about.title: What is roast!?

colab.description: Roast! would be nothing without the participation of roasters, exhibitors, speakers and sponsors. If you fall into this category, be sure to click to find out more. Maybe you'll be interested in what we have to offer. And if not, drop us an email and maybe we can work something out.

exhibitors.text: Are you interested in our event and would you like to participate? We are looking for roasters, cafes and speakers.
exhibitors.title: Roasters and presenters

sponsors.text: Are you a company that likes to support cultural events? You can be rewarded with a logo on the event, promotional materials, tickets and interesting packages for your employees.

exhibitors.title: Roasters and presenters

101.annotation: At 101.ROASTERY, we believe that good coffee tastes great anytime, anywhere. That's why we carefully select the best beans, roast them with the utmost precision, and fine-tune every step to ensure that the resulting flavor is always perfect. Whether you enjoy your coffee with us or at home, you can be sure that it's just right. ‚òï

baristaroasters.annotation: We are a small roastery from southern Slovakia. We have been roasting select coffee for 6 years. We strive to find the most interesting coffees, whether in terms of their story or flavor profile, so that they are memorable and provide an experience.

black.annotation: Specialty coffee is a product we have trusted since our beginnings in 2017. We started with a small espresso bar but our curiosity took us further. Today we are a local roaster from Bratislava with global ambitions. We are building a brand that is worth following for its uncompromising commitment to unique varieties, interesting flavours and innovative roasting style. Because although we are black. we're constantly striving to make every day a little brighter and more special.

coffeespot.annotation: We are a select roastery from Babice. Since 2011, we have been selecting and roasting only the best beans for you, so that you can feel that we have put everything into our coffee from the very first sip, and bid it a bittersweet farewell with the last. We enjoy what we do and who makes up our roastery. Thanks to this, we have a really close relationship both here among ourselves and with our suppliers from all over the world. And over the years, we dare say that we have the same relationship with our customers. We roast small batches every day to ensure that our coffee is always fresh. Nothing leaves our doors that we haven't tasted and approved.

annotation: Coffee Culture, an Ostrava-based coffee project run by two enthusiasts of the world of specialty coffee. Our goal is to bring specialty coffee to the widest possible audience.
We regularly focus on fresh coffee harvests from around the world. The key for us is to recognize the maximum potential of each one and then bring it out to the fullest during roasting.

Our customers are caf√©s and enthusiasts who already know their way around specialty coffee, but also caf√©s that want to improve their output. We help them with both education and technical support. Many of them have found their niche in a professional approach to barista work and the diverse flavors of specialty Arabica coffees.

chcikofein.annotation: We are Miro and Maru ‚Äì husband and wife, coffee addicts, and a little bit crazy, roasting coffee for like-minded enthusiasts. We roast in a one-kilogram roaster because we like to experiment, and a smaller roaster allows us to do that. It also means we can change our range more often, and from time to time you will find some real limited editions.

dalia.annotation: A roastery from Sil≈Øvky near Brno, we roast excellent select coffee on a modern Coffee Crafters hot-air roaster. Come and taste both classic and experimental coffees at our brew bar.

annotation: Dos Mundos is a coffee roaster based in Prague. Our coffee is the result of meticulous work and a passion for discovering new flavours that reflect the unique character of each coffee region. We work directly with farmers to ensure fair conditions and promote sustainable coffee growing practices.

In addition to selling coffee, we also focus on spreading coffee culture through workshops, tastings and educational programs. Dos Mundos is a place where tradition meets innovation and where passion for coffee is transformed into a real experience.
Knock, knock... Who's there? Francine Roasters! Who? Just good coffee!
They have caffeine in their blood and a roaster as their weapon. Their mission? To roast a selection and deliver a coffee that makes you go, "Mmmm, this is how it's supposed to be".

Filtered with a hint of fruit? Espresso that tastes like a chocolate dream? Franti≈°ek and Olda, our main roasters, always have an answer. It's also because we support small farmers. We buy coffee directly from them, so every bean has a story and we know what we're offering.

We also like to experiment - we have a coffee for the hipster and your grandmother because we believe everyone deserves the perfect cup. And most importantly, we're no quick-fixes - we roast with love and care because we know where we're coming from and where we're going.

We're pretty wide ranging with over 30 varieties of coffee from all over the world, so there's something for everyone. In addition, we have two caf√©s of our own - Go Francin in Sm√≠chov and Kafe Fracin in Letn√° - and we are working on another one.
Because we have something for everyone, we even have capsules packed with the best selection.

We can proudly say that in Libe≈à, where we roast our pedigree coffees every day, it smells like heaven on earth - and when you add our humour to the mix, it's clear that this coffee is not made by a boring corporation.

gills.annotation: We are one of the oldest and friendliest coffee roasters in the center of Brno, run by Marek and Martin. Over the years, we have figured out what we want, and now we are bringing it to you at the festival.

hayb.annotation: Hi, How Are You Brewing? We‚Äôre HAYB - speciality coffee roasters based in Warsaw, Poland. We like fun processings, risky bean experiments, but we also enjoy the stable quality of ordinary daily brews - both the funky and the classic ones. We want those beans to bring some colour to your cup - every day and on special occasions. We roast with the deepest respect for the origin. No compromise on taste. No compromise on quality. This job drives us energetically not only due to caffeine. All done for you to deal with your coffee with ease and joy, having fun with various possibilities that good coffee can give you. Effortlessly!

annotation: We do what we love. Coffee.
We are a newly opened roastery that focuses on quality, taste and culture. Coffee beans from different parts of the world are roasted to bring out their potential and flavor.
The variety in coffee offerings ensures that you will always make the right choice when selecting your coffee.

We are a young roastery with a selection of coffees located near Brno, in Hradƒçany near Ti≈°nov. We carefully select coffee beans from different parts of the world to bring you coffee that offers a unique taste experience.
Each batch is roasted with love and care because we believe that coffee should be an experience.
IG Coffee Roasters - these are select coffees where every bean has its own origin and story.
As our valued partners and sponsors, you'll find IG at their own booth on both Saturday and Sunday! üñ§

Our name is Kmen. That means "the Tribe" in czech, it has deep roots and gives rise to new branches. Petr, our head roaster, brought fine coffee to South Bohemia eight years ago with his then roastery Fragaria Coffee and has a long history behind the bar at Caf√© Datel. It was there that his collaboration with Lucia and Kry≈°tof, who are involved in running the roastery and espresso bar, began. We've all been working with choice coffee for a long time, but together everything is new for us: new name, new people, new space and new packaging too

We don't believe in one right taste, every crop, every field is different and tastes different. Whether we were in Panama or Peru, we were secretly eating ripe coffee cherries on the farms. There, you realise that coffee is actually a fruit. And this is what we want to say with our packaging and everything - coffee does not have one universally correct taste, quite the opposite. So on every bag you will find the fruit (admittedly, sometimes it will be nuts, chocolate or gummy bears) that is most characteristic of the coffee.
There, on a hill in Lhota overlooking the surroundings, where the farmers used to store their tools and grain on the cuttings, stands OUR KOLNA - the Czech artisan coffee roasting shop.

We are a family-run roastery just outside Benesov and thanks to our many years of experience and knowledge of coffee we can offer you coffee of the highest quality. We offer coffees for lovers of bitter and chocolate flavours, as well as for coffee enthusiasts who enjoy fruity (yes sour) flavours and interesting processing methods.

labanda.annotation: La Banda Caffeina ‚Äì a caffeine cartel for everyone who isn't afraid of strong flavors and even stronger decisions. Each bean is the result of a secret operation between fire and time, creating a pure taste and aroma that will put you in a trance. Join our gang and drink coffee without compromise forever.

liskafe.annotation: We have been operating since 2022 and we are probably one of the smallest roasters in Brno. We work only with a selection of coffees and we are currently most interested in fermented and fruit-infused coffees, which is why you will find several of them in our offer. And since we roast in small volumes and try to change our coffee portfolio often, almost everything is a bit of a limit. If you'd like to taste our coffee, drop by the Mug caf√©, which is at the end of the 12 bus in Brno.

lot.annotation: We are Lot ‚Äì a coffee roastery from Bratislava, where we believe that great coffee is no accident. Every step, from selecting the beans to roasting, is done with the aim of capturing the true flavor and character of coffee. If you're looking for pink, you'll find us. See you in Brno!

mamacoffee.annotation: At mamacoffee, we combine the highest quality coffee with fair and sustainable trading. We focus on working directly with the farmers to deliver not only a great cup of coffee, but also the unique stories behind it. You can buy coffee and much more from our e-shop or from one of the 7 cafes we operate in Prague. Where, in addition to delicious coffee, you can also enjoy pastries from our own artisan bakery.

annotation: Welcome to The Miners! We are a specialty coffee roaster and a growing network of cafes proudly operating in the Czech Republic and Spain.

At The Miners, we believe that great coffee starts at the source. That's why we work exclusively with specialty coffee, proudly sourcing beans directly from the most respected farmers around the world. We carefully roast beans from 13 different countries, using special roasting methods that highlight the unique flavors of each origin. Our dedicated team is committed to thorough research and relationship building to ensure that every cup you enjoy is the epitome of quality and honest craftsmanship.

We understand that exceptional coffee deserves exceptional baristas. That's why we've created a comprehensive weekly training course that prepares our baristas to make you the perfect cup every time. The training culminates in an exam that ensures our baristas have all the necessary knowledge and skills.

We believe in excellence in everything we do, and our commitment to quality is reflected in every carefully roasted bean. We use modern, cutting-edge technology such as La Marzocco and Slayer coffee machines to ensure that every cup is prepared with the utmost precision and care.

At The Miners, we are driven by a passion for sourcing the best beans from the best farmers around the world. Our team works hard to build strong relationships with these dedicated growers who share our unwavering commitment to world-class excellence.

parabellum.annotation: Para Bellum Lounge is an establishment combining quality hookahs and a modern bar in the very centre of Brno. It is an ideal place for a friendly board game session, a quiet home office with fast internet, or a date with a tasty drink and an excellent pipe. You can find us near Malinovsky Square at Sukova 4.

penerini.annotation: We are Petr, Nela, Rita and Nikola, a family that loves coffee. At the family table, the idea of quality coffee for home users, coffee enthusiasts, baristas and coffee drinkers was born, and from it came the roastery Penerini coffee. We are creating a coffee culture across the Czech Republic through courses and participation in events, festivals and events. We surround ourselves with people who crave perfect flavours as much as we do and sell what we love most.

pikola.annotation: We are Pikola. At the foot of the Jesen√≠ky Mountains we roast the finest coffee with respect for its origin. We are constantly on the lookout for exceptional coffees that stand out from the norm in terms of aroma and taste. Thanks to long-term relationships with our suppliers and farmers, our roastery offers you fresh coffees from this year's harvest. Our offerings are changing, but the freshness and quality remain. We do everything with respect and love for nature.

annotation: What happens when a geologist, a builder, an economist and an engineer from the same town in the foothills of the Beskydy Mountains, who share a passion for coffee, meet after years of separation? This is how a bad joke or our story could start. Maybe it was fate or just chance that brought the friends together after returning from opposite corners of the world to breathe life into an artisanal coffee roastery in the promised land and city of unlimited possibilities, filled with inspiration and years of experience with fine coffee from Australia and Britain.

We started looking for premises suitable for a coffee shop and roastery in late 2019, although the idea itself dates back a couple of years earlier when one of the co-owners was making a living as a barista on the Gold Coast and the other two started discovering the magic of speciality coffee in Edinburgh and Glasgow. We soon realised that combining a roasting space with an espresso bar wasn't going to be quite so easy - hats off to QB in Brno and Nordbeans' Dock in Liberec, but suitable venues were scarce in Brno. After we acquired our first roasting machine in early 2020, a suitable space in a historic building from the 1920s finally came up in Brno to set up shop, at least according to some of our ideas. However, the road to opening in the covid era combined with a complete renovation was thorny, and we launched a live operation in July 2021. Even before the opening of the caf√© we understood that the capacity of the roasting machine (2 kg) would not be enough. After moving to the current premises in Husovice, we purchased a Kuban machine in July 2021 - a gas roaster with a capacity of 12 kg.

We were born as a Punkt caf√©. in the first specialty coffee wave, like a little Berlin on Bayerova Street in Brno. With the arrival of the new branch on ≈†tef√°nikova Street, we gradually started to build a roastery. At both spots you can taste our daily production, which we regularly supplement with funky limits in our offer. Slowly but surely, we are succeeding in getting our coffee beyond our premises into homes and businesses
We'll see you at the festival on Saturday at the espresso bar and Sunday at the brew bar. We look forward to seeing you there.

quickborn.annotation: Quickborn Roastery is a specialty coffee roastery that brings a unique experience directly to you, wherever you are. With our stylish horsebox and portable bars, we can create an authentic coffee atmosphere in the most unusual places.

mala_prazarna.annotation: We re a small coffee roastery located in the heard of Ljubljana, Slovenia. Our happy place is next to our local coffee community. Finding the best coffees we can, gives us the biggest high. It will be our first time in Brno and we cant wait ti meet you all

ohmybean.annotation: We are Oh My Bean, and we have dedicated our lives to coffee. We roast it for our own caf√©s and dozens of others in Czechia and abroad, we take care of your caffeine supplies at home or at work, and above all, we are here for you so that you don't get lost in the world of coffee. We advise, explain, and show you. We believe that choosing, preparing, and drinking good coffee is not just for the chosen few, but for everyone.

rebelbean.annotation: Rebelbean is a roaster of specialty coffee, it also is their own network of cafes and most importantly it's an energy for everyone who is not afraid to be a Rebel and go for their ideas and dreams. We live and do business in Brno and we are happy to be able to supply energy to this festival.

wildkaffee.annotation: Wildkaffee is a specialty coffee roastery based in Farchant, near Garmisch-Partenkirchen in Germany. Established in 2010 by Stefanie and Leonhard Wild, the company is guided by four core principles: quality, innovation, transparency and sustainability. Each roast is a considered expression of these values, a reflection of thoughtful sourcing, precise technique and a deep respect for the art of coffee. With bases in Austria and Thailand, and a growing presence around the globe, Wildkaffee coffees are enjoyed by discerning partners and coffee lovers worldwide.

red_fawn.annotation: We are Red Fawn from Trnava ‚Äì two brothers who love specialty coffee. We roast sweet and juicy coffees that don't taste like a compromise. Fresh harvests, pure taste full of fruit and character. Come and taste the experience, not just caffeine.

trafficcoffee.annotation: We are Traffic Coffee ‚Äì a roastery from Olomouc, where we create select coffee with character. We roast traditional beans as well as bold experiments such as barrel-aged coffee from aromatic alcohol barrels. Both coffee conservatives and adventurers will find something to their liking here.

tripple_five.annotation: We are a specialty coffee roaster in Bratislava. We carefully select the highest quality varieties from different corners of the world. Through careful roasting, we strive to bring out the full flavor that each bean has to offer.

the_roses.annotation: A family business run by brothers Vojtƒõch and Maty√°≈° R≈Ø≈æiƒçka together with their father Old≈ôich. Since 2017, they have been focusing on specialty coffee with an emphasis on quality, fair trade, and sustainability. We purchase coffee directly from producers around the world, operate caf√©s, a training center for baristas, and a roastery.

ws_home.name: How NOT to make a filter
ws_home.annotation: Taste and see how poor filter preparation affects the flavor. We will answer the question of why we prepare drip coffee within certain parameters and put into context the variables that affect the flavor of coffee, whether positively or negatively.

ws_sensory.name: Sensory training - supercharge your senses
ws_sensory.annotation: We see with our eyes and taste with our whole body. This workshop will focus on sensory perception and teach you how to perceive taste, smell, and touch more accurately‚Äîand how to connect your senses into a single whole. You will discover that even ordinary water can have dozens of flavor nuances and that sensory perception is not the preserve of sommeliers or baristas, but of each and every one of us. Through practical training, you will open the door to a deeper understanding not only of coffee, but also of food, wine, and life itself.

ws_yerba.name: After this Yerba Mat√© workshop, you'll stop drinking coffee
ws_yerba.annotation: Discover why Yerba Mat√© is conquering the world as a healthier alternative to coffee. This workshop will reveal why Yerba Mat√© surpasses coffee in terms of energy, concentration, and lifestyle. Come and taste the change directly from the founder of the largest Yerba Mat√© brand in Czechia and Slovakia. You will learn how to prepare Yerba and how to benefit from it in the long term.

ws_water.name: Water ‚Äì more important than coffee itself
ws_water.annotation: Let's take a closer look at water. Although it is not widely known, water is more important than anything else when it comes to making coffee. Have you ever wondered why the filter coffee tasted great at the caf√©, but the same beans suddenly didn't taste as good at home? Here's the answer.

ws_whisky.name: The story of whiskey
ws_whisky.annotation: The story of whisky's journey from barrel to glass. The workshop will also include whisky tasting by Tom√°≈° Dyntar and pairing with specialty coffee.

ws_cupping_penerini.annotation: Come and taste coffee from the Peneriny roastery. Cupping is lead by the Peneriny roastery staff.

ws_cupping_traffic.annotation: Come and taste coffee from the Traffic Coffee roastery. Cupping is lead by the Traffic Coffee roastery staff.

ws_roasting.name: Roast your own beans
ws_roasting.annotation: Every roaster has, in addition to their beloved large roaster, a small test roaster. This is used to roast samples from importers and farmers. During the workshop, you will learn how to work with such a small roaster. You will receive a few dozen grams of coffee of your choice, which you can roast and take home with you.

ws_esko.name: Your own espresso
ws_esko.annotation: In two consecutive workshops (Espresso and Latte Art), we will look at the basics of preparing specialty coffee. How to set up the grinder correctly, why we use scales, and how to prepare milk for latte art correctly.

ws_qb.name: Cupping uncensored
ws_qb.annotation: Discover how coffee tastes when you remove all filters. At the workshop, you will learn the basic rules of cupping‚Äîa professional method of coffee tasting that reveals its aromas, flavors, and flaws. Together, we will go through the entire process step by step. At the end, you will taste unusual coffees‚ÄîArabica, Canephora, and rare Liberica.

ws_choco.name: Discover the beauty and diversity of chocolate
ws_choco.annotation: Did you know that high-quality chocolate can be very similar to high-quality coffee? In this workshop, you will learn about the history of chocolate, how it is made, and the different types available. All this will be accompanied by a guided tasting.

ws_kaple.name: Tasting and wine sensory analysis
ws_kaple.annotation: Something like cupping, but in the world of wine. Join us as we take a look at the forms of tasting and identifying wine defects.

ws_hradsky.name: Dripper Showdown
ws_hradsky.annotation: At a time when a new dripper for preparing filtered coffee is created every week, it is not easy to navigate the range on offer. In this workshop, you will prepare coffee together using five different drippers and have the opportunity to compare how each one affects the taste, aroma, and overall character of the cup. You will see for yourself how small differences between drippers can change the resulting coffee experience, and you may discover which dripper is right for you.

ws_latte.name: Your own cappuccino
ws_latte.annotation: In two consecutive workshops (Espresso and Latte Art), we will look at the basics of preparing specialty coffee. How to set up the grinder correctly, why we use scales, and how to prepare milk for latte art correctly.

ws_cupping_chicas.annotation: Come and taste coffee from the Chicas Industry coffee importers. Cupping is lead by the Chicas Industry staff.

ws_cupping_lot.annotation: Come and taste coffee from the LOT roastery. Cupping is lead by the LOT roastery staff.

ws_cupping_punkt.annotation: Come and taste coffee from the Punkt roastery. Cupping is lead by the Punkt roastery staff.

talk_biology.name: Coffee for everyone (even children?)!
talk_biology.annotation: We all love coffee, but what does caffeine do to our bodies? And what happens when caffeine is consumed by children? Pediatrician Dr. Barbara ≈†≈•astn√° will talk about how much caffeine adults and children consume today and what it does to us.
talk_biology.bio: Medical doctor Barbara ≈†≈•astn√°, a pediatrician working for Jihomoravsk√© dƒõtsk√© l√©ƒçebny (South Moravian children's sanatories). Among other things, Barbara is a trainer at the Loono organization, a fencer and archer at a summer camp for children, and an amateur tailor.

talk_green.name: Seven burning questions about green coffee
talk_green.annotation: Importer Tereza from Chicas Industry covers seven of the hottest topics in the world of green coffee‚Äîand devotes exactly seven minutes to each one. From the difference between fermentation and infusion, to the myth of the "poor farmer", to the question of whether we are asking too much of coffee. Fast-paced, sharp points, and seven different perspectives that may change your view of the coffee world.
talk_green.bio: I am a mom, entrepreneur, lover of foreign cultures and languages, and formerly a frequent traveler. I have been involved with coffee since 2011, and with specialty coffee since 2014. Since 2019, together with my colleague Karol√≠na, I have been developing the Chicas Industry project focused on importing green coffee.

talk_humberto.name: Celebrating Coffee‚Äôs Transformative Power
talk_humberto.annotation: We will discuss the impact of coffee and how it can transform people's lives across the entire supply chain. This includes its effects at origin, as well as the roles of importers, roasters, baristas, and guests.
talk_humberto.bio: Humberto Ribes, a Spanish barista living in Berlin. Currently Head of Coffee at the Five Elephant roastery in Berlin. Among other things, Humberto is a talented photographer.

talk_ks.name: Coffee journalism on the rise
talk_ks.subheading: The editorial team of K√°va spojuje
talk_ks.annotation: How do you write about coffee and gastronomy in a way that readers will enjoy? The editors of K√°va spojuje magazine will openly reveal everything that goes on "behind the keyboard" ‚Äì from finding topics to behind-the-scenes interviews to what never makes it past the editors' scrutiny. Come take a peek into the editorial kitchen and ask anything you want to know about journalism.
talk_ks.bio: We believe that "coffee connects". We are an online editorial team that aims to become a trusted voice connecting the coffee community across the Czech Republic.

talk_helena.name: Coffee quality from farm to cup
talk_helena.annotation: What goes into turning a coffee bean into a aromatic cup on your table? Helena Oliviero from Italy's SCA will guide you through the journey of coffee, from cultivation on plantations, through harvesting and processing, to roasting and preparation. You will learn how each step affects the final taste and why quality is not created in the cup, but long before that.
talk_helena.bio: Helena Oliviero is a multiple winner of coffee competitions, a Q-Grader, and an experienced trainer who discovered her passion for coffee while working part-time in Tuscany. After years spent in various European countries, she has become a respected expert and inspiration for baristas and coffee lovers around the world. In her work, she also addresses the issue of gender inequality in the coffee industry and encourages women to have the courage to change stereotypes.

talk_alice.name: Bean There, Roast That, Roasting through play, myths, and alchemy
talk_alice.annotation: Just pour in the green beans, turn on the roaster, and you're a roaster, right? Basically, yes. In this lecture, we will show that coffee roasting is not just about "feeling", but about consistency, data, and understanding the processes. We will break down the basics and add tips on how to approach roasting with perspective and ease.
talk_alice.bio: A coffee professional with more than 15 years of experience in gastronomy. Alice comes from Slovakia but has also lived in Greece and Germany for some time. She is currently the head roaster at the Rebelbean roastery in Brno. She also coached two-time Czech Barista Championship winner Denis Kram√°≈ô.

talk_tanzanie.name: Coffee in Africa - how to do business in Africa
talk_tanzanie.annotation: He escaped from computers, spreadsheets, and figures straight to Africa. Ladislav Kol√°≈ô from Jind≈ôich≈Øv Hradec turned his life upside down and went from being a successful financier and co-owner of a brokerage company to a coffee grower. In Tanzania, he manages his own coffee plantation covering almost 30 hectares, provides jobs for local people, and also supports schools.
talk_tanzanie.bio: The Kol√°≈ô family from Kolda Coffee. Owners of a 28-hectare plantation in the Mbeya region of Tanzania, they planted their first tree in 2012 and harvested their first coffee beans in 2016. Today, they have 86,000 trees on their farm, support sustainable agriculture, keep bees, build water retention areas, and work with the local community.

talk_madalin.name: About competitions
talk_madalin.annotation: About the course and participation in Austrian coffee competitions and the WBC in Milan. Just a week before the Roast! Festival, the Austria Coffee Championship takes place. How did the competition go? We will find out from the Austrian Barista of the Year 2020, Madalin Truica.
talk_madalin.bio: Madalin Truica, a coffee professional working as Head Barista at The Pelican Coffee Company in Vienna. He was born in Romania but grew up in Germany and has been involved in the coffee community for at least 10 years. In 2020, he won the Austria Barista Championship.

talk_tripplesenzory.name: Sensory battle ‚Äì what do wine, beer, and coffee have in common?
talk_tripplesenzory.annotation: What do good wine, decent beer, and specialty coffee have in common? And how do their worlds differ? A brewer, winemaker, and roaster will share their experiences with the sensory properties of these three traditional beverages and show that the world of flavors is much more diverse than you might think.
talk_tripplesenzory.bio: The panel discussion will feature Michaela Nem√©thov√°, "beer doctor", certified BJCP judge, and brewer. Also participating will be Ji≈ô√≠ Vyzourek, whose great passion is natural wines, which he deals with professionally at the Kaple wine bar in Brno. Last but not least, they will be joined by Jan ≈Ωid≈Ø, roaster and owner of the Au Lait espresso bar in Brno, who will take care of "the coffee part".

talk_influencers.name: Like, share, drink ‚Äì gastroinfluencing on social media
talk_influencers.annotation: Instagram, TikTok, YouTube ‚Äì where does food taste best today? Three different food influencers reveal how food and drink are presented on social media, what is just a well-arranged illusion, and what is genuine passion. A discussion about authenticity and creative content.
talk_influencers.bio: Well-known Brno Instagram reporter Pavel ƒåern√Ω will meet with his "colleagues in the field", coffee YouTuber and podcaster Tom√°≈° Taussig and gastro-freelancer and social media manager Petra Vlkov√°.

party_soutez.name: Competition in coffee brewing
party_soutez.annotation: Details are brewing as we speak. Stay tuned.

roasters.title: Roasters at Roast
text: The following roasters have confirmed their participation at this time. And more will follow. If you miss your favourite roastery here, write to them about us!

others.title: Accompanying program
text: Refreshments and other accompanying program are provided by the following partners.

info.text: Would you like an espresso or maybe a cappuccino? That and much more is waiting to be tasted by you at our especially busy espresso bars. During the festival, there will be many different roasters on rotation, each with their own coffee to show off.
info.title: Espresso done right

info.text: Filtered coffee, this is a different discipline. V60, Chemex, Aeropress or Coldbrew? You can also taste these coffees at our brew bars. We give roasters complete freedom to choose the preparation that best suits their beans.
info.title: Filtered coffee of all kinds

info.text: You don't just want to watch, you want to experience it for yourself? Discover the ins and outs of coffee roasting, cupping, alternative preparations, experimental flavour pairing and much more. Our professional baristas will guide you through everything and will be happy to answer any questions.
info.title: Workshops

info.text: Again this year you can look forward to a wide range of lectures on all possible and impossible topics. Our special guests will guide you through the nooks and crannies of coffee technology, chemistry or culture you may not have known existed.
info.title: Lectures

lastYear.description: Roast! 2025 will be the third Roast we are preparing for you. In 2023, when the festival was founded, we tried for the first time what it is like to prepare a coffee festival and whether such an event has its place in Brno. We found out that it does. By the next edition, Roast 2024, the festival had more than doubled in size and exceeded all our expectations.

text: We are a group of Brno coffee enthusiasts and professionals who decided to bring the culture of European coffee festivals to Brno.
You can meet individual members of our team behind the bar in several Brno cafes, roasters, bars and other establishments.
What binds us together is our love for specialty coffee and gastronomy.

items.title: Unlimited coffee consumption
items.text: With the price of admission, you can sample coffees from all the roasters present throughout the festival.

items.title: Lectures
items.text: You can expect lectures from well-known caf√© owners, coffee roasters and other personalities from the industry. Take the unique opportunity to meet those who make it possible for you to enjoy the finest coffee. Admission to the lectures is included in the price of admission.

items.title: Workshops
items.text: Try out different coffee brewing methods or roast your own coffee. Capacity of the workshops is limited, so come early. Participation in the workshops is included in the price of admission.

items.title: Cuppings
items.text: Are you curious about how the taste descriptions of individual coffees are created? Come and taste coffee as it is tasted and evaluated by professionals. Participation is included in the price of admission.

items.title: Cups and mugs
items.text: For each participant there is a reusable coffee and beer cups available and ready to be borrowed. A deposit is paid on site. And of course there is also a cup rinse available free of charge for everyone so we all can enjoy each coffee from a clean cup.

items.title: Chill-out zone
items.text: If you want to relax during the festival, we have a relaxation area with deck chairs and seating.

items.title: Specialty coffee to buy
items.text: Tasting coffee for two days in a row is not easy, that's why we also offer other snacks of all kinds. Beer, lemonade, coffee-based and other cocktails, salty and sweet food, hookahs... Whatever you can think of.

items.title: Festival merchandise
items.text: As well as coffee, we also have various other coffee products available for purchase. Plus, special Roast! Festival merch.
